data.title: Encoursa™
data.meta_description: NetSuite has everything you need to grow, all in one place.We support over 34,000 customers in 217 countries and territories around the world. As the world’s fi...
data.text:
Hayley Null

Manager, Alliance and SDN Marketing

NetSuite

Hayley Null is Manager, Alliance and SDN Marketing at NetSuite where she leads demand generation efforts for NetSuite’s Alliance Partners and SuiteCloud Developer Network (SDN) Partners to create impactful joint content and campaigns for NetSuite and its partners. Prior to this role, Hayley served as the Industry Marketing Lead for Food & Beverage and Manufacturing at NetSuite and a Business Development Consultant at Oracle. She has a Bachelor of Business Administration from the University of Michigan and is based in Chicago, Illinois.

Larry Mellon

Tax Director - Chief Tax Office, Vertex

NetSuite

Larry Mellon is tax director in the Chief Tax Office at Vertex, where he is responsible for providing insights, thought leadership and customer-centric direction. He joined Vertex in 2005 as a sales and income tax supervisor and has served as tax manager since 2012. Prior to joining Vertex, he was a senior tax accountant and property tax manager at Foamex International. Mellon also held multiple roles at the Franklin Mint and is a member of the Institute of Professionals in Taxation.

Kristine Yon

Senior Marketing Manager, SDN

NetSuite

Kristine Yon is a Senior Marketing Manager, SDN at NetSuite where she focuses on demand generation efforts for NetSuite’s SuiteCloud Developer Network (SDN) Partners to create impactful joint content and campaigns for NetSuite and its partners. As a marketing professional, Kristine has worked previously for Kaplan Test Preparation and The Walt Disney Company. She has a Master’s degree from the UCLA Anderson School of Business and is based in Los Angeles, California.

Colleen Wanty

Sr. Director of Product Marketing, FloQast

NetSuite

Colleen S. Wanty is a seasoned marketing professional with over two decades of expertise in the dynamic IT, software, and consulting services industries. Specializing in SaaS, Cloud, on-premise, and hybrid solutions, including ERP, HR, Accounting, and custom-engineered offerings, she brings a comprehensive understanding of the sector. Colleen’s diverse background encompasses sales, marketing, product management, consulting, and accounting roles, providing her with a holistic perspective on business operations. She has held senior-level positions in leading corporations, mid-sized firms, and innovative startups, including FloQast, Kadiri, Jamcracker, Groundswell, BearingPoint/KPMG, and Accenture. Grounded in a structured, data-driven appr... Read more

Jamar Cobb-Dennard, J.D.

Speaker

NetSuite

Jamar Cobb-Dennard is a business broker at Indiana Business Advisors. The company has 40 years of experience helping more than 2,100 business owners prepare, value, and sell their businesses.

As a leadership consultant, Jamar specializes in teaching business owners how to advance their careers through effective leadership, networking, sales and communication skills. Over the last 4 years, Jamar has also been called on by Indiana University-Purdue University Indianapolis, the National Association of African-American Insurance Agents, Bethany Christian Services, and others to discuss diversity and inclusion strategies.

Jamar has led trainings for Veolia Water, the Indianapolis Chamber of Commerce, Indianap... Read more

Tom Kelly

Director of Product Marketing and Management, NetSuite

NetSuite

Tom Kelly is the Director of Product Marketing and Management for the Oracle NetSuite Global Business Unit, responsible for Global Cloud Financials and the General Business and Hi-Tech industry verticals. Before joining NetSuite, Tom founded T-Edward, a strategic and operational cloud consultancy providing cloud expertise and CXO services for companies in the Fortune 500 to start-ups. Prior to T-Edward, Tom held a variety of executive financial and technology related positions with large cap companies including PepsiCo, eFunds and Deluxe Corporation, as well as small cap, privately held entities such as FullContact and PeopleNet Communications.

Jennifer Elder

Speaker

NetSuite

Jennifer Elder, CSP, CPA, CMA, CIA, CFF, CGMA helps financial leaders become more strategic, stay ahead of the competition, and be more successful.

Jennifer has a track record of success helping organizations develop a business strategy to rise above the herd, capture their market, and be consistently successful and profitable. For more than 25 years, Jennifer has been speaking and consulting for organizations in all 50 states and 9 countries. Her clients include privately held companies, not-for-profits, trade associations, the Fortune 500, and state and Federal governments.

In addition to being a CPA, Jennifer is also a Chartered Global Management Accountant (CGMA), Certified Management Accountant (CMA), C... Read more

Manuel Cabral

NetSuite Industry Solution Advisor

NetSuite

Manuel has over 22 years of finance and accounting experience working for public and private companies including Chipotle Mexican Grill and Cummins Engines. He was the Corporate Controller for Cummins’ Rocky Mountain, and STT Energy - an Oil and Gas exploration company. Manuel joined NetSuite in 2016 and has spent the last 6 years assisting organizations to transition from manual to automated accounting practices utilizing Oracle NetSuite. The world's first and best-in class solution that provides end-to-end cloud-based financials. Before joining NetSuite, Manuel implemented the system in three different companies, so he understands the ERP and credit-to-cash needs from the end-user and solution provider perspective.

Sue Ulrey

Speaker, Executive Director with MorganFranklin

NetSuite

Sue Ulrey serves as an executive director in MorganFranklin’s risk advisory practice with a specific focus on serving the financial services and healthcare markets. Prior to joining MorganFranklin, Sue successfully oversaw risk management, internal controls, quality assurance, data analytics, and contract compliance engagements for numerous publicly traded and midsized organizations across a range of industries. She served as vice president and national practice advisory leader at Global Commerce & Information, Inc. (Global CI). As a former Big 4 managing director and principal at a top 15 CPA firm, Sue led global multi-year risk advisory projects, and is a recognized thought leader and a highly sought-after speaker.

Sue is a l... Read more

Paul Mack

Speaker, Grant Thornton Director

NetSuite

Paul Mack has 25 years of continuous experience as a project manager and an architect of Oracle EPM solutions. Paul has been involved with over 20 Oracle Planning implementations ranging from global organizations to start-ups. Paul’s focus is providing the leadership and guidance to ensure that his clients get great EPM solutions, have processes in place that fully leverage their investment, receive the training necessary to support their new system, and continue to get the advice and support required to be successful over time.

Paul is a Finance expert with experience in designing EPM solutions for a wide range of industries including banking, retail, and pharma. He is also the architect of several of Grant... Read more

Craig Clay

DFIN President, (Moderator)

NetSuite

Craig Clay is a dynamic, growth-oriented executive specializing in mission-critical document and information management who has built, managed, integrated and transformed highly successful services and outsourcing businesses.

Currently, he leads and motivates teams globally in the largest division of Donnelley Financial Solutions, Inc. (NYSE: DFIN), a leading global risk and compliance solutions company. DFIN provides domain expertise, enterprise software and data analytics for every stage of our clients’ business and investment life cycles.

Prior to this, he served as senior vice president at R.R. Donnelley leading the Global Capital Markets and Legal Process Outsourcing business. Before joining the company, he was a financi... Read more

Jack Cassel

Speaker, Head of New Listings, Nasdaq

NetSuite

Jack Cassel is Nasdaq’s Head of New Listings. He oversees Nasdaq’s IPO business for North America, Europe and the Middle East. Prior to this role, Jack oversaw Nasdaq’s IPO business for the western US and managed Nasdaq’s Private Market business. Prior to joining Nasdaq, Jack worked as a vice president at GrowthPoint Technology Partners and at Morgan Stanley’s Private Bank. Preceding his entry into the business world, Jack played Major League Baseball for the San Diego Padres and Houston Astros. While playing baseball, Jack cofounded Players for the Planet, a nonprofit organization that utilizes professional athletes to promote environmental awareness.

Jim Neesen

Speaker, Managing Partner, Connor Group

NetSuite

Jim is the Managing Partner at Connor Group, the #1 Accounting Advisory firm in the world for IPOs, SPACs, and high-growth companies.

Connor Group has worked on over 150 IPO and SPAC transactions in the past decade including Tesla, Spotify, Uber, Lyft, Palantir, Snap, Etsy, Survey Monkey, Stichfix, Mulesoft, and 1,000+ top tech, biotech, and growth companies. Our IPO and SPAC client base has raised over $35B in IPO proceeds at a $265B valuation when going effective.

Jim is a guest lecturer and CEO mentor at Stanford’s Graduate School of Business where he graduated with a Master's degree and launched a career as a lifelong entrepreneur.

Jim is active with multiple NFL player initiatives, mentoring NFL players and busines... Read more

Willie Quinn

Speaker, Chief Financial Officer, Bolt Biotherapeutics, Inc.

NetSuite

Willie Quinn, Chief Financial Officer, joined Bolt Biotherapeutics in 2020, bringing extensive experience in finance, operations, and business development leadership in the biopharma industry. Prior to joining Bolt, Mr. Quinn served as the chief financial officer and senior vice president of corporate development at Sunesis Pharmaceuticals (acquired by Viracta Therapeutics), where he led the company through multiple public financings and corporate collaborations.

Before joining Sunesis, Mr. Quinn co-founded and was chief executive officer of Bullet Biotechnology, an immuno-oncology company developing therapeutic cancer vaccines discovered at Stanford University. Previously, Mr. Quinn was instrumental in estab... Read more

Brian Sowell

Presenter, Senior Consultant at Bryant Park Consulting

NetSuite

Brian Sowell (CPA) has over 20 years of experience in Business Intelligence, EPM, and Planning systems in Senior Technical, Functional, and Consultant roles. For the last 4 years, he has focused on delivering NetSuite’s Planning and Budgeting solution across many industries including Manufacturing, Banking, Oil and Gas, Retail, Healthcare, Services and Software industries. Prior to focusing on NSPB, Brian implemented several other financial planning and analysis systems. Brian has a BBA in Accounting and has experience in a wide range of industries from his time in Big 4 accounting.

Sharon E. Tetlow

Speaker, Managing Partner, Potrero Hill Advisors

NetSuite

Ms. Sharon E. Tetlow, MBA, is the founder of Potrero Hill Advisors and has been its Managing Partner since January 2016.

Ms. Tetlow has 30 years of experience in life sciences finance. She has extensive experience working with public and private investors, managing teams and providing strategic support to boards and executives.

Among other roles, she has served as Chief Financial Officer of Cell Genesys, Pathwork Diagnostics, and diaDexus; Venture Partner at Apax; Corporate Treasurer at Synergen; and Finance Manager at Genentech.

A veteran of the life sciences industry, she leverages her broad professional network of C-level executives, investors, and key industry influencers to bring the right people to the table. She... Read more

Liz Briggson (NetSuite)

Speaker

NetSuite

Liz Briggson joined the Encoursa team in 2017, bringing a unique mix of accounting, finance, and sales experience. Liz is passionate about education and helping people reach their potential.

Liz's corporate finance experience includes progressive finance roles with Kellogg Company, Amway, and Open Systems Technologies. At Amway, Liz was responsible for management reporting for Amway’s portfolio companies and financial planning & analysis for Amway’s finance and executive divisions. Prior to that, Liz served clients in the utilities, insurance, and manufacturing industries in the assurance practice at PricewaterhouseCoopers.

Liz is a licensed CPA in the state of Michigan. She leads Partnerships & Education... Read more

Manuel Cabral

Industry Solution Advisor

NetSuite

Manuel has over 22 years of finance and accounting experience working for public and private companies including Chipotle Mexican Grill and Cummins Engines. He was the Corporate Controller for Cummins’ Rocky Mountain, and STT Energy - an Oil and Gas exploration company. Manuel joined NetSuite in 2016 and has spent the last 6 years assisting organizations to transition from manual to automated accounting practices utilizing Oracle NetSuite. The world's first and best-in class solution that provides end-to-end cloud-based financials. Before joining NetSuite, Manuel implemented the system in three different companies, so he understands the ERP and credit-to-cash needs from the end-user and solution provider perspective.

Alec Epstein

Presenter, CEO at Bryant Park Consulting

NetSuite

Alec is the founder and Managing Partner of Bryant Park Consulting. He is an experienced professional services leader with hands-on experience guiding large and midmarket organizations through multi-faceted systems and business process transformation efforts. Prior to founding BPC, he led the unprecedented growth and success of another boutique technology consultancy, and prior to that was a lead ERP consultant in Oracle NetSuite’s professional services organization. Outside consulting, Alec leads projects in early childhood education, social entrepreneurship, real estate, and venture capital. He loves cold brew coffee and Texas-style barbeque, and spends his weekends bicycling around his beach town and kayaking Florida’s beautiful water... Read more

Adriana Carpenter

NetSuite Guest Speaker; CFO of Emburse

NetSuite

As CFO of Emburse, Adriana is responsible for financial strategy, accounting, treasury, payroll, and financial reporting, planning and analysis. Adriana has 30 years of finance and accounting experience. Prior to joining Emburse, Adriana was the SVP Finance and Chief Accounting Officer at Ping Identity where she managed through several significant transitions, including preparing and operating Ping as a public company. Before joining Ping in 2013, Adriana was the Global Controller at TeleTech where she managed multinational accounting and shared service operations. Adriana also spent 12 years in PwC’s assurance practice, serving multinational clients in IT and communications, aerospace and defense.

Jeff Womer

Speaker, Partner - Technical Accounting & IPO Services, SOAProjects, Inc.

NetSuite

Prior to joining SOAProjects in 2021, Jeff spent 30 years in PwC’s Assurance Practice, including 15 years as a Partner with the Firm and two National Office tours. From 2015 to 2018 he was selected and served a National Office tour as PwC’s SEC Services Technology Industry Portfolio Lead Partner, responsible to bring the highest level of GAAP technical accounting and SEC knowledge and experience to a large number of PwC’s public company clients in the technology industry.

Jeff brings a broad range of skills and perspectives to his clients but specializes in advising and assisting those that need consultation in the preparation of registration statements to be filed with the SEC, whether... Read more

Matt Rafferty

Speaker, Manager Technical Accounting, SAOProjects, Inc

NetSuite

Prior to joining SOAProjects, Matt was a Senior Associate at BDO serving both public and private clients in the technology and hospitality industries. Matt has supported clients through every stage of the ASC 606 process, from adoption to disclosure in the financial statements. He has experience in ongoing public company filings with a variety of bundled products and services. At SOAProjects, Matt works with his clients on SSP methodologies, contract reviews, POB analyses, preparing financial statements disclosures, and drafting 606 technical memos. Matt lives and works in Salt Lake City, Utah.

Erik Wallen

Speaker, Regulatory General Counsel, Sovos

NetSuite

Erik Wallin is a Regulatory General Counsel in the Sovos Regulatory Analysis and Design Department. Erik has been a member of the Sovos team for over 10 years and focuses his work on U.S. transaction tax law which includes special expertise in the taxation of technology and the taxation mechanisms that apply throughout the Colorado home rule jurisdictions. Erik is a member of the Massachusetts Bar, has a B.A. from York College of Pennsylvania, a J.D. from New England School of Law, and an L.L.M. in Taxation from Boston University.

John Patrick

Speaker, IT Risk & Compliance Manager at Bridgepoint Consulting

NetSuite

John Patrick is a proven IT Risk and Compliance Manager with over 15 years of experience across a multitude of skillsets including cybersecurity and data protection, internal audit, and security and compliance. John’s experience includes leading IT internal audits for public companies, managing IPO readiness projects for various industries, evaluating technology environments and controls for public company readiness, and performing various IT assessments.

Philip Peck

Vice President - Finance Transformation & Advisory Services at Peloton

NetSuite

Philip brings over thirty-five years of consulting and industry experience with a specific focus on planning, forecasting, reporting, and analytics assessment efforts, digitally enabled business process transformation, and optimizing technology investments to enable superior performance. He has led numerous process improvement and finance transformation projects for global companies across various industries that span data governance and decision analytics, scorecard development and implementation, management reporting and analysis, budgeting and forecasting, information management business requirements, and business transformation roadmap development. Mr. Peck is a frequent speaker on planning and performance management subjects a... Read more

Dan DeVall

Vice President of Business Development at Airbase

NetSuite

Dan is the Vice President of Business Development at Airbase. He previously held leadership roles at Coupa and Tipalti. Prior to jumping into fintech, he spent over a decade in banking at Wells Fargo Bank, where he was a key leader in establishing their tech banking group focusing on software and fintech companies.

Amanda Hustedt

Principal at ArcLight Consulting

NetSuite

Amanda is a Principal in the Cloud Solutions practice at ArcLight Consulting, an Addison Group company. She is an experienced professional with over 20 years of Oracle experience. She has designed much of ArcLight’s Business Transformation and Customer Success Strategy. From her start implementing Benefits and Compensation plans in Oracle E-Business Suite to managing full suite implementations and now building the broad relationships necessary for true transformation, Amanda has worked to ensure her customers reach their business goals.

Amy Senders

Director at Bridgepoint Consulting

NetSuite

Amy is a Director in the Cloud Solutions practice at Bridgepoint Consulting, an Addison Group company. Her expertise in the ERP ecosystem spans from technical integration design and development to functional business process development and configuration. In 9+ years of NetSuite experience she has worked on clients across many industries and verticals and has a deep knowledge of the best ways to connect NetSuite to other systems. She enjoys solving tough problems for clients and helping fellow employees learn and grow in their careers.
